text: Lambach is a market town in the Wels-Land district of Upper Austria, Austria. It is on the Ager and Traun Rivers. It had about 3,242 peopleas of 2001. A major stop on the salt trade, it is the site of the Lambach Abbey, built around 1056. Between 1897 and 1898 lived Adolf Hitler there and attented the school. ==References== Category:Settlements in Upper Austria
title: Lambach
